# HealthTrack Pro Sprint Planning Meeting Report

## Brief Overview
This report summarizes the key outcomes of the HealthTrack Pro Sprint Planning Meeting, focusing on aspects most relevant to your role as Frontend Developer.

## Key Meeting Highlights
- Sprint 1 (June 24 - July 7, 2024) focuses on implementing secure user authentication and basic profile management
- The sprint backlog totals 32 story points, including a 3-point buffer
- Technical stack confirmed: React.js with TypeScript, Redux, and Tailwind CSS for frontend
- Cross-browser compatibility identified as a potential risk

## Sprint 1 Gantt Chart
![Diagram](https://mermaid.)

## Your Action Items and Next Steps
1. Set up the frontend environment with React.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Redux
2. Begin work on the user registration form (4 story points)
3. Prepare for implementing the login form and handling authentication token (3 story points)
4. Plan the profile management page with forms for viewing and editing user information (4 story points)
5. Collaborate with Liam on navigation between login, registration, and main app pages (2 story points)
6. Implement early browser testing to mitigate cross-browser compatibility risks
7. Attend the data security and GDPR compliance session led by Alex on June 25, 2024

## General Team Information
- Daily stand-ups will be held at 9:30 AM
- Jira will be used for project management; expect an invitation from Sarah
- The Definition of Done includes code standards, unit testing, and cross-browser compatibility
- Sprint Review and Retrospective is scheduled for July 8, 2024
- MVP features now include basic goal-setting functionality

## Conclusion
Your role is crucial in implementing the frontend components for user authentication and profile management. Focus on creating responsive and intuitive interfaces while ensuring cross-browser compatibility. Remember to collaborate closely with the UI/UX designer and backend team to align on implementation details. If you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to reach out to Sarah or the team.
